content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

function clean_column(col)
    # First, split the string into words but keep them as a single array for processing
    words = split(col, " ")

    # Now, iterate over each word in the array
    for i = 1:length(words)
        # Lowercase the word
        words[i] = lowercase(words[i])

        # If it starts with a hyphen or a space, remove it
        if words[i][1] == '-' || words[i][1] == ' '
            words[i] = words[i][2:end]
        # If it ends with a hyphen, remove it
        elseif words[i][end] == '-'
            words[i] = words[i][1:end-1]
        end

        # If the word ends in 's', add an underscore if there
